alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 29 at 4:58AM HST until April 29 at 8:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Oahu in Honolulu County * Until 800 AM HST. * At 458 AM HST, the Waikane stream reported a rapid rise in water level, and has reached a level that can lead to the closure of Kamehameha Highway due to water over the roadway. Flooding is occurring in Waikane Stream and other nearby drainages. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Stream Gauges. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waikane, Waiahole, Kahaluu, Kaaawa, Ahuimanu, Punaluu, Pearl City, Mililani, Aiea, Hauula, Wahiawa, Halawa, Moanalua, Kaneohe, Salt Lake, Laie, Kaneohe Marine Base, Kalihi, Maunawili and Kahuku. This warning may need to be extended beyond 800 AM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
